Description: Scarab carved from stone; underside incised with a hieroglyphic inscription, giving the name of Amun-Ra.
Curator's comments: Scarab not yet located, published by Petrie (Petrie 1886, pl. XXXVIII, no. 182; Petrie 1889, pl. 61, no. 1960). The inscription on the underside can be compared to a scarab in glazed composition published by Gardner, though it needs to be read from left to right (in Gardner 1888, pl. XVIII, no. 39). Gardner, E. A. 1888, Naukratis. Part II (Sixth Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Petrie, W.M.F. 1889, Historical scarabs: a series of drawings from the principal collections arranged chronologically, London.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXVIII, no. 182)
Petrie 1889 / Historical scarabs: a series of drawings from the principal collections arranged chronologically (pl. 61, no. 1960)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OA.80) (phase 3)
